docs.title: Sumbawanga Development Action
docs.text: Testing to see how changes propagate. Currently, we are really encouraged to see what transformative change the support of our generous supporters can bring in Greening Kalalasi.

docs.title: LaTeX Math Support
docs.text:
LaTeX math is supported using MathJax.

Inline math looks like \(f(x) = x^2\). The input for this is $f(x) = x^2$. Use $...$.

For a block of math, use $$...$$ on separate lines

$$
F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4
$$

gives

\[ F(x) = \int^a_b \frac{1}{2}x^4 \]

docs.title: Mermaid diagrams
docs.text:
Here's the example from MkDocs Material documentation: 

graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];

docs.title: Text Formatting
docs.text:
You can have lists like this

  • first
  • second
  • third

Or checklist lists to

  • Get
  • things
  • done

Also, get highlights and strikethroughs as above (similar to Obsidian).

More formatting options for your webpage here. (but not compatible with Obsidian)

docs.title: Beds in Schools
docs.text: When we visited Kanyele Secondary School we found students’ mattresses on the floor. It was impossible for them to maintain a good level of tidiness in their dormitories. We decided to provide the students with bunk beds which made the students very happy.

docs.title: Greening Kalalasi
docs.text: Kalalasi Village was bare without trees. People had cut trees for cooking fuel. As a result the villagers faced a huge problem of dust during dry season windy days that caused respiratory diseases. They identified the problem and asked us to help plant trees. We worked in partnership with them to plant trees and encouraged them to preserve the local trees. Now there is no more dust problem and there are trees everywhere.
